Excellent rip!  So I'm not complaining or anything, but I'm curious why in the SRT subtitles (not the spoken text, but ONLY the accompanying descriptive text) it seems that for every instance  there *should* be a letter "S," the letter "D" is displayed instead.

e.g., The SRT file has "HOLMED: [dialogue]" when it should be "HOLMES: [dialogue]"  Or "[HORDED WHINNYING]" (*horses*) and "[MAN CHANTING INDIDTINCTLY]" (*indistinctly*)

I'll give it another go in a few months, but for now I'll just get other releases.

LOL @Suspira79 :-)
The comments about the sound being out of synch are right, and it is noticeable enough to be annoying. So if you don't use a media player that can fix this, don't download. But as others pointed out, if you use VLC it's no trouble at all. Advanced settings > synchronisation > +200ms and the synch is perfect.

It's not crappy. It can play anything and everything. If you're judging it's "crappiness" based on Windows Media Player, Winamp, or other so-called popular media players, you're fucking nuts. I honestly have nothing against Winamp, but I myself prefer VLC. MPC from the awesome CCCP gang is also awesome in this sense, but both VLC and MPC have their share of awesomeness and basically can undergo a centuries-long battle for awesomeness.
